meanings.definition: To remove the testicles of (a male animal or person)
meanings.sent1: The farmer decided to castrate the bull to prevent breeding.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian castrated the stray cat to control the population.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a sight to see a rooster trying to castrate another rooster!
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter seemed to castrate the once lively garden.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer's curse was said to castrate the kingdom's prosperity.

meanings.definition: To render impotent or deprive of vitality
meanings.sent1: The toxic relationship seemed to castrate his self-confidence over time.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's oppressive regime aimed to castrate the spirit of the people.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning robot accidentally castrated the power supply, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments online can castrate one's motivation if not handled wisely.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to castrate the once vibrant colors of the sunset.
